programme.title: POL v FRA- Men's Quarter-Final - Volleyball | Tokyo 2020 Replays
programme.desc: The Men's Quarterfinal Match between Poland and France took place on 03/08/2021 at the Ariake Arena, Tokyo. Fial Score FRA 3: 2 POL

programme.title: Quarter Finals, Semi Finals & Finals - Day 11 - Morning Session - Boxing | Tokyo 2020 Replays
programme.desc: This event took place on 03/08/2021 at the Kokugikan Arena, Tokyo. It includes the Women's Feather (54-57kg) Final and Victory Ceremony, Quarterfinals of the Women's Light (57-60kg), Men's Fly (48-52kg) and Men's Light (57-63kg) Weight class as well as a Men's Feather (52-57kg) and Men's Heavy (81-91kg) Semifinal.

programme.title: Ornella: knocking down social prejudices pursuing her Olympic dream | Playing Fields
programme.desc: As the first female boxer to represent her country, Ornella shows us why it’s important for the world to see more female African boxers on the global stage.

programme.title: Neymar at age 17
programme.desc: Neymar had only just turned professional in 2009 but his outstanding talent ensured he was expected to become a Brazil football legend.

programme.title: Novak Djokovic at age 21
programme.desc: A day in the life of a 21-year-old Novak Djokovic when he was living and training in Monte Carlo.

programme.title: This transgender volleyball player’s path leads to an NCAA women’s team
programme.desc: Follow Chloe Anderson as she heads to UC-Santa Cruz and meets her new team-mates for the first time.

programme.title: Veronica Campbell-Brown at age 18
programme.desc: Veronica Campbell-Brown's schooling in her hometown of Clarendon, Jamaica brought discipline and the inspiration to become a sprint legend.

programme.title: Can France’s handball idol Jerome Fernandez save this struggling team?
programme.desc: Double Olympic gold medalist Jerome Fernandez attempts to return success to a U15 handball team in southern France.

programme.title: Khalifa: An Olympic dream in the heart of Africa’s football powerhouse | Playing Fields
programme.desc: A young Ghanian football player takes us into his world. Through his community, family and team we learn why football is so important to him and what he hopes to accomplish one day.

programme.title: DOM v KOR - Bronze Medal Game - Baseball | Tokyo 2020 Replays
programme.desc: The Bronze Medal Games was played on 07/08/2021 at the Yokohama Baseball Stadium, Yokohama. The Dominican Replublic claimed the Bronze with a 10:6 victory against South Korea

programme.title: SWE v KOR - Women's Quarter-Final - Handball | Tokyo 2020 Replays
programme.desc: This Women's Quarterfinal Match took place on 04/08/2021 at the Yoyogi National Stadium, Tokyo. Final Score SWE 39:30 KOR

programme.title: ROC v NOR & LAT v BRA - Men's Quarter-Finals - Beach Volleyball | Tokyo 2020 Replays
programme.desc: This event took place on 04/08/2021 at the Shiokaze Park, Tokyo. It includes the Men's Quarterfinal Matches Leshukov/Semenov (ROC) v Mol/Sorum (NOR) & Plavins/Toks (LAT) v Alison/Alvaro Filho.

programme.title: Mat A: Men's Greco-Roman & Freestyle - Day 12 - Wrestling | Tokyo 2020 Replays
programme.desc: This event took place on 04/08/2021 at the Makuhari Messe Hall A, Tokyo. It includes the Men's Greco-Roman 67kg Repechage and the Men's Freestyle 57kg 1/8 and 1/4 Finals.

programme.title: Heats & Quarter-Finals - Day 12 - Canoe Sprint | Tokyo 2020 Replays
programme.desc: This event took place on 04/08/2021 at the Sea Forrest waterway, Tokyo. It includes the Women's Canoe Single 200m, Women's Kayak Single 500m, the Men's Kayak Single 200m and Men's Kayak Double 1000m Heats and Quarterfinals.

programme.title: Khalifa: An Olympic dream in the heart of Africa’s football powerhouse | Playing Fields
programme.desc: A young Ghanian football player takes us into his world. Through his community, family and team we learn why football is so important to him and what he hopes to accomplish one day.

programme.title: Semi-Finals Women's -51kg, -69kg & Men's +91kg and Finals Men's -81kg - Boxing | Tokyo 2020 Replays
programme.desc: This event took place on 04/08/2021 at the Kokugikan Arena, Tokyo. It includes the Men's Light Heavy (75-81kg) Final and Victory Ceremony as well as Women's Fly (48-51kg), Women's Welter (64-69kg) and Men's Super Heavy (+91kg) Semifinals.

programme.title: DOM v KOR - Bronze Medal Game - Baseball | Tokyo 2020 Replays
programme.desc: The Bronze Medal Games was played on 07/08/2021 at the Yokohama Baseball Stadium, Yokohama. The Dominican Replublic claimed the Bronze with a 10:6 victory against South Korea

programme.title: Can France’s handball idol Jerome Fernandez save this struggling team?
programme.desc: Double Olympic gold medalist Jerome Fernandez attempts to return success to a U15 handball team in southern France.

programme.title: Heroes of The Future 2 | Episode 2
programme.desc: In this episode: Agentinian sport climber Valentina Aguado, Mexican diver Randal Willars Valdez, and Puerto Rican boxer Lionel Colon.

programme.title: Ayomide: Born in a canoe, now a Nigerian rowing star | Playing Fields
programme.desc: Her mother gave birth to her inside a canoe some 20 years ago. Ayomide Bello grew up to become the first female canoeist from Nigeria to qualify for the Olympics.

programme.title: Ezra: A high-jumper finds community and another chance | The Starting Line
programme.desc: As high-jump reigning World Champion, Ezra Frech prepares to return to the Paralympics for the second time. He reflects on his remarkable journey with his father and together with his mother, he takes us to meet their wider and beloved Californian community as they organize a unique event for adaptative sports in Los Angeles.

programme.title: Nikoloz: The judo World Champion from two nations | The Starting Line
programme.desc: When Nikoloz Sherazadishvili’s family moved him from Georgia to Spain at a young age, his father instilled a love of judo in him. He quickly felt at home at the local club of Brunete, in the outskirt of Madrid, where everything started with his first coach Quino Ruiz. As he gears up for his second Olympics, surrounded by his family and friends, he’s competing on the mat for Spain but also holding Georgia and the memory of his father close to his heart.

programme.title: Carlota: Proving herself and her sport to the world | The Starting Line
programme.desc: A young female breaker for France, Carlota Dudek is training to qualify for the Olympics to showcase her unique style to the world, inherited from her mother Cuban origin. We travel with her from Paris to her hometown in the heart of Provence where her life-long dance journey began.

programme.title: Manon: How the bond with her horse changed her life | The Starting Line
programme.desc: Two-time medallist in dressage at Tokyo 2020, Manon Claeys shares her inspiring journey back from severe injury to Paralympic podium. After her accident, she thought she would never ride a horse again. Now, together with her cherished horse Katarina, and surrounded by her team and family, she trains to achieve a gold medal at Paris 2024.

programme.title: Opening Ceremony - Ceremony | Tokyo 2020 Replays
programme.desc: The Opening Ceremony of the Tokyo 2020 Summer Olympic Games took place on 23/07/2021 at the Olympic Stadium, Tokyo.

programme.title: Africa Cycling Revolution
programme.desc: A lively journey across six African countries to uncover a new generation of cyclists and how the sport is reaching new audiences.

programme.title: Women's Road Race - Cycling Road | Tokyo 2020 Replays
programme.desc: This event took place on 25/07/2021 with the Start at Musashinonomori Park and the finish on Fuji International Speedway. Anna Kiesenhofer (AUT) claimed the Gold, Annemiek van Vleuten (NED) Silver and Elisa Longo Borghini (ITA) completed the podium.

programme.title: Ezra: A high-jumper finds community and another chance | The Starting Line
programme.desc: As high-jump reigning World Champion, Ezra Frech prepares to return to the Paralympics for the second time. He reflects on his remarkable journey with his father and together with his mother, he takes us to meet their wider and beloved Californian community as they organize a unique event for adaptative sports in Los Angeles.

programme.title: Ferdinand: The Beast from the East returns to his roots | The Starting Line
programme.desc: Known as the ‘Fastest Man in Africa’ for his prowess in the 100m, Ferdinand Omanyala is setting his sights on becoming the fastest man in the world at Paris 2024. We follow him as he travels back to his hometown of Kitale in Kenya to get the blessings he needs from his peers and uncover the remarkable story of his origins.

programme.title: Nikoloz: The judo World Champion from two nations | The Starting Line
programme.desc: When Nikoloz Sherazadishvili’s family moved him from Georgia to Spain at a young age, his father instilled a love of judo in him. He quickly felt at home at the local club of Brunete, in the outskirt of Madrid, where everything started with his first coach Quino Ruiz. As he gears up for his second Olympics, surrounded by his family and friends, he’s competing on the mat for Spain but also holding Georgia and the memory of his father close to his heart.

programme.title: Carlota: Proving herself and her sport to the world | The Starting Line
programme.desc: A young female breaker for France, Carlota Dudek is training to qualify for the Olympics to showcase her unique style to the world, inherited from her mother Cuban origin. We travel with her from Paris to her hometown in the heart of Provence where her life-long dance journey began.

programme.title: Manon: How the bond with her horse changed her life | The Starting Line
programme.desc: Two-time medallist in dressage at Tokyo 2020, Manon Claeys shares her inspiring journey back from severe injury to Paralympic podium. After her accident, she thought she would never ride a horse again. Now, together with her cherished horse Katarina, and surrounded by her team and family, she trains to achieve a gold medal at Paris 2024.

programme.title: Women's 3m Springboard Preliminary - Diving | Tokyo 2020 Replays
programme.desc: This event took place on 30/07/2021 at the Tokyo Aquatics Centre, Tokyo.

programme.title: Mixed Team QFs/SFs/Finals - Archery | Tokyo 2020 Replays
programme.desc: This event took place on 24/07/2021 at Yumenoshima Park Archery Field, Tokyo. Republic of Korea claimed the Gold, Netherlands the Silver and Mexico completed the podium.
